name: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol
Reason: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for our comparison will be 2-methoxyphenol, which has a melting point of 20 degrees Celsius. The compound has two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would notably augment the melting point. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100 degrees Celsius to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. Additionally, the hydroxyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group also raises the melting point due to additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The vinyl group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The carbonyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius.
